strings.Value: "Get out, before I bury you all here!"
"Who are you and what are you doing here?"
"What is this place?"
"Forget this. I'm leaving."
"We can help each other. Let me go ahead and deal with the traps, and you cover my back. We'll split the loot, half for me, half for you. Deal?"
"You know this a plague tomb, right? All these corpses died from disease. My blessings preserve me, what about you?
[Attack] "You've picked the wrong tone to speak with the {mf|baron|baroness|king|queen}. Death to grave-robbers!"

{n}In the dim light, you come across a group of armed men with swords and bows — two of them are squatting near the body of a halfling. Spotting you, one of the men stands up and regards you with a crooked sneer.{/n} "Well now, men, look — a corpse that don't know it's dead yet."
"Didn't hear me the first time? Get out of here — now!"
"What, you come to loot the place?" {n}The leader bares his teeth.{/n} "You're too late — we were here first, and we're keeping what we found! We're scholars, see, this is our find!"
"Can't you see for yourself? Ree-surch-ass, we are! Ree-surching this crypt now, everything we find? Why, we give to the poor." {n}The leader chuckles, and the other bandits join in.{/n}
{n}Gang leader stares at you, baffled.{/n} "Why should I? We just pry the door open — then we'll see who's buried there and how much gold's with them."

"Short of it is — the crypt's our find. We'll deal with the traps ourselves and start ree-surching right away." {n}The man nods at you, then nods at the exit.{/n} "And you'd better leave, before you catch something."
{n}The leader stares at you for a few moments, chewing his lip, then nods.{/n} "Deal. Men, let {mf|him|her} through!"
"What, you think we'll just let you run on ahead, take what's ours? Kill {mf|him|her}!"

{n}The leader's face looks blankly at you for a moment, then the men behind him begin to shuffle, whispering amongst themselves.{/n} "Plague?" {n}The man echoes, which makes the men behind him begin to mutter prayers under their breath and glance around.{/n} "Ah… no, no we didn't know that. Seems… seems we might want to get out to some fresh air. Get out of this hole." {n}He turns to the men behind him.{/n} "Come on, out, everyone out!"
"You take me for an idiot, {race}?! Let's see how clever you are after we run you through!"

"Wha..? Is that so?" {n}The leader steps toward you and locks eyes with you. As he attempts to stare you down, his angry expression falters, and he swallows.{/n} "Hnh — you're serious — and as mad as they come."
"Oh, is that so? We'll see who buries who!"

"There are some markings on the pillars over there." {n}The bandit points toward a massive column.{/n} "Also that halfling idiot wouldn't shut up about some old book… satisfied? Now get while you still can!"

"We're here on a job, see. This one here hired us." {n}The leader nods at the halfling corpse on the floor.{/n} "Needed help to get into these ruins. And we were like — why not." He clicks his tongue sadly. "But a shame — soon as the little one showed us the way in, he became ill. Must be the excitement, I bet."
"Such villainy! You murdered a man who trusted you! And now, to cap it off, you dare to utter threats against the legitimate ruler of these lands!"
"He came to the house of the dead as a merry guest, but settled here forever... Such is the lot of mortals, yes... But what of their murderers? Will they escape their victim's fate?"
"Run, run! But don't lose your pants! Ha ha! You really gave them a good one. Watching them turn tail is even more fun than if we'd killed them!"
"Yes, fellows, that'll be your grave now... Shouldn't have gotten tough with me and the baron{mf||ess}!"
{n}The leader tries to save face with an uneasy chuckle.{/n} "Well now, this hole certainly isn't worth fighting over. We'll find easier pickings."
"We'll see who dies today..."
{n}Valerie looks at the bandit, then the corpse at his feet. She reaches for her weapon.{/n} "Dirty marauders. We cannot let them go."
"Consorting with these animals! And about what? Robbing ancient tombs!" {n}Valerie seems almost ready to spit with disgust.{/n}
"Why are you trying to deceive these scoundrels? The only thing they deserve is immediate payback for their pillaging!"
"You decided to scare them and let them escape? Those scoundrels are marauders and murderers! And we should just let them go?"
"Let us cleanse your lands of this filth!"
"Hey, {name}! What is scolar? Like Hero? Or bad thing?"
"Would you look at that! Quite a pet, eh? Wouldn't mind getting this one myself, heh heh..."
"Huh. Sounds like goblin king, all proud and aloof. Scolar thing must be bad word after all."
